So in particular, herrings, it seems, the catching and selling of these fish was during the 18th and 19th centuries, the most important element in the economy of fishguard and the area.
So as fishermen, they would go around shouting, calling themselves the fishgut herrings or Skadan aboghwine.
They'd be going around the markets shouting fishgut herrings and naturally with kind of Wales' high interest in nicknames, people of fishguard were known as the fishgut herrings or Skadan aboghwine.
And there's a really nice sculpture down in Lowes Hound kind of celebrating that by John Cleel.
